metadata.title: CVE-2022-1325 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in Clmg, where with the help of a maliciously craftedpandore or bmp file with modified dx and dy header field values it ispossible to trick the application into allocating huge buffer sizes like 64Gigabyte upon reading the file from disk or from a virtual buffer.

criterions.comment: cimg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
